| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [EvilHack 0.8.2, monst.c - line 3102](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/v0.8.2/src/monst.c#L3102)                                                             |

An **elven wizard**, @, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). They are a type of [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") that are mid-level spellcasters, stronger than the likes of [orc shamans](/wiki/Orc_shaman "Orc shaman") and [gnomish wizards](/wiki/Gnomish_wizard "Gnomish wizard").

An elven wizard can cast [magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile") and arcane [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), and will [grudge](/wiki/Grudge "Grudge") any [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") he encounters (and vice versa). Elven wizards possess [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") like other elves, and also possess [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") due to their magic missile spell, as well as [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") like other living spellcasters.

Eating an elven wizard [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 3⁄5 chance of conveying sleep resistance.

## Generation

Randomly-generated elven wizards will always be peaceful towards [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") characters, and will also be peaceful towards other [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") characters that are not [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)").

Two hostile elven wizards are generated within the Minas Tirith-like variant of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios"). There is a 1⁄3 chance of a sleeping elven wizard being generated within the cross-aligned shrine in the [Orc Temple](/index.php?title=Orc_Temple\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Orc Temple (page does not exist)") variant of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End").

The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") may create a clone of himself in the guise of an elven wizard via the [Double Trouble](/wiki/Double_Trouble "Double Trouble") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

Elven wizards have a 1⁄2 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an [elven helm](/wiki/Elven_helm "Elven helm"), a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots"), and a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger").

### EvilHack

In EvilHack only, four hostile elven wizards appear within the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower_\(EvilHack\) "Wizard's Tower (EvilHack)") at level creation: two of them are generated randomly on the middle floor, and the other two are stationed within the southern wing of the top floor.

## Encyclopedia entry

The Elves sat round the fire upon the grass or upon the sawn  
rings of old trunks. Some went to and fro bearing cups and  
pouring drinks; others brought food on heaped plates and  
dishes.  
"This is poor fare," they said to the hobbits; "for we are  
lodging in the greenwood far from our halls. If ever you are  
our guests at home, we will treat you better."  
"It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party," said Frodo.  
Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for  
his mind was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the  
sound of voices so various and so beautiful that he felt in a  
waking dream. \[...]  
Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to  
himself, what he felt or thought that night, though it remained  
in his memory as one of the chief events of his life. The  
nearest he ever got was to say: "Well, sir, if I could grow  
apples like that, I would call myself a gardener. But it was  
the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean."  
\[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]
html:
Elven wizard

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ elven wizard (No tile)
Difficulty 11
Attacks Spell-casting 2d4 magic missile, Spell-casting
@ elven wizard (No tile)
Difficulty 11
Attacks

Spell-casting 2d4 magic missile, Spell-casting

Base level 9
Base experience 179
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 25
Alignment -10 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 800
Nutritional value 350
Size Medium
Resistances sleep, magic
Resistances conveyed sleep (60%)

A elven wizard:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack 0.8.2, monst.c - line 3102

An elven wizard, @, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. They are a type of elf that are mid-level spellcasters, stronger than the likes of orc shamans and gnomish wizards.

An elven wizard can cast magic missile and arcane monster spells, and will grudge any orcs he encounters (and vice versa). Elven wizards possess sleep resistance like other elves, and also possess magic resistance due to their magic missile spell, as well as telepathy like other living spellcasters.

Eating an elven wizard corpse or tin has a 3⁄5 chance of conveying sleep resistance.

Generation

Randomly-generated elven wizards will always be peaceful towards elven characters, and will also be peaceful towards other chaotic characters that are not orcs.

Two hostile elven wizards are generated within the Minas Tirith-like variant of Fort Ludios. There is a 1⁄3 chance of a sleeping elven wizard being generated within the cross-aligned shrine in the Orc Temple variant of Mines' End.

The Wizard of Yendor may create a clone of himself in the guise of an elven wizard via the Double Trouble monster spell.

Elven wizards have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with an elven helm, a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with elven boots, and a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with an elven dagger.

EvilHack

In EvilHack only, four hostile elven wizards appear within the Wizard's Tower at level creation: two of them are generated randomly on the middle floor, and the other two are stationed within the southern wing of the top floor.

Encyclopedia entry

The Elves sat round the fire upon the grass or upon the sawn
rings of old trunks. Some went to and fro bearing cups and
pouring drinks; others brought food on heaped plates and
dishes.
"This is poor fare," they said to the hobbits; "for we are
lodging in the greenwood far from our halls. If ever you are
our guests at home, we will treat you better."
"It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party," said Frodo.
Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for
his mind was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the
sound of voices so various and so beautiful that he felt in a
waking dream. [...]
Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to
himself, what he felt or thought that night, though it remained
in his memory as one of the chief events of his life. The
nearest he ever got was to say: "Well, sir, if I could grow
apples like that, I would call myself a gardener. But it was
the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean."
[ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]

An '''elven wizard''', {{brightblue|@}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. They are a type of [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]] that are mid-level spellcasters, stronger than the likes of [[orc shaman]]s and [[gnomish wizard]]s.

An elven wizard can cast [[magic missile]] and arcane [[monster spell]]s, and will [[grudge]] any [[Orc (monster attribute)|orcs]] he encounters (and vice versa). Elven wizards possess [[sleep resistance]] like other elves, and also possess [[magic resistance]] due to their magic missile spell, as well as [[telepathy]] like other living spellcasters.

Eating an elven wizard [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|3|5}} chance of conveying sleep resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated elven wizards will always be peaceful towards [[Elf (starting race)|elven]] characters, and will also be peaceful towards other [[chaotic]] characters that are not [[Orc (starting race)|orcs]].

Two hostile elven wizards are generated within the Minas Tirith-like variant of [[Fort Ludios]]. There is a {{frac|3}} chance of a sleeping elven wizard being generated within the cross-aligned shrine in the [[Orc Temple]] variant of [[Mines' End]].

The [[Wizard of Yendor]] may create a clone of himself in the guise of an elven wizard via the [[Double Trouble]] [[monster spell]].

Elven wizards have a {{frac|2}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] an [[elven helm]], a {{frac|4}} chance of being generated with [[elven boots]], and a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with an [[elven dagger]].

===EvilHack===
In EvilHack only, four hostile elven wizards appear within the [[Wizard's Tower (EvilHack)|Wizard's Tower]] at level creation: two of them are generated randomly on the middle floor, and the other two are stationed within the southern wing of the top floor.

==Encyclopedia entry==

	dishes.
	"This is poor fare," they said to the hobbits; "for we are
	lodging in the greenwood far from our halls.  If ever you are
	our guests at home, we will treat you better."
	"It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party," said Frodo.
	Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for
	his mind was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the
	sound of voices so various and so beautiful that he felt in a
	waking dream.  [...]
	Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to

	in his memory as one of the chief events of his life.  The

	apples like that, I would call myself a gardener.  But it was
	the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean."
	   [ The Fellowship of the Ring, by J.R.R. Tolkien ]
